title: Doom 3 preorder
body: <p>I went to <a href="http://www.bestbuy.com/site/olspage.jsp?id=pcmcat19200050015&type=category">Best Buy</a> last night and <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/archive/2004/05/12/Doom_III.aspx">preordered Doom 3</a>.  You only have to pay $10 right now, and you get this <a href="http://www.bestbuy.com/site/olspage.jsp?id=1067389449015&skuId=6174132&type=product">little bonus pack</a> with a little pewter mancubus figurine, a poster, a coupon for $5 off any RTCW game for the PC, and a $10 coupon for an nVidia FX5700 or FX 5900.  Then on the release date you just show up with your receipt and they'll take the $10 you've already paid off of the final price.  I've never preordered a game before but it makes sense to do it that way.  In fact I'm pretty sure that the last game I've bought for the PC was Doom 2 (I'm not 100% positive, but I haven't been able to think of another game that I've bought since). Of course Doom 2 was $35 not $55, damn inflation.</p><p>Of course I had to see <a href="http://digitaldeals.net/modules.php?name=News&file=article&sid=11523">this deal yesterday</a>.  An <a href="http://www.creative.com/products/product.asp?prodid=9103">Audigy 2NX (Dolby 7.1, etc.)</a> for only $52 and free shipping?  Considering the crappy onboard sound I have now, I was pretty much obligated to buy it.  So that doubled the price of the game so far.</p><p>Then I had to get some 7.1 speakers to go along with it.  I saw <a href="http://www.buy.com/retail/product.asp?sku=10355392&loc=101">these at buy.com</a> and I couldn't resist.  <a href="http://www.creative.com/products/product.asp?prodid=5076">Creative's marketing BS</a> even says that they're the perfect compliment to the Audigy 2NX. So now the final tally of Doom 3 for me is <strong title="$175?!?!? OMGWTF!?!">$175!</strong> Ah well, I need speakers and a better soundcard anyway.  Plus I'm sure Doom 3 is worth it.</p><p>It's made me wonder though.  If someone as cheap as me is spending this much money on the damn game, how many other people are going to be a sheep like me?  I think it'll be bigger than Quake 3 was.  It will be a welcome boost to the PC industry.</p>
